alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 9:47PM CDT until April 13 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Walker County in central Alabama... Eastern Marion County in northwestern Alabama... Western Winston County in northwestern Alabama... Fayette County in west central Alabama... Southeastern Lamar County in west central Alabama... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 946 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Haleyville to near Millport, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Haleyville, Carbon Hill, Millport, Lynn, Guin, Berry, Double Springs, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Kennedy, Kansas, Nauvoo, Belk, Gu- Win, Eldridge, Houston Recreational Area, Ashbank and Ashridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
